definitions.definition: having a close and friendly relationship

examples.text: We're not **on intimate terms with** our neighbours.

definitions.definition: private and personal, often in a sexual way

examples.text: The article revealed **intimate details** about his family life.
the most intimate parts of the body

definitions.definition: encouraging close, friendly relationships, sometimes of a sexual nature

examples.text: He knew an intimate little cafe where they would not be disturbed.
an intimate knowledge of the English countryside
an **intimate connection** between class and educational success

definitions.definition: having a sexual relationship with somebody

wordOrigin: adjective early 17th cent. (as a noun): from late Latin intimatus, past participle of Latin intimare ‘impress, make familiar’, from intimus ‘inmost’.
